p.s: With the novel Gun Love, written by Jennifer Clement and published in 2019, we learn a lot about the life of Pearl and her homelessness.
We experience how much problems she has to fight with because of the living conditions in the trailer park.
An interesting idea to improve these standartsstandards, is that CPSChild Protective Services should take Pearl away from her mother to bring her to a foster home.
With this, Pearl would have much more opportunities to get out of her situation.
She would be a part of the society!
With a life in a real city, she could go to school too, but could help herself and work to get out of her life situation.

She could do a side job while school and would have in general more help of others and maybe also from the social systen when she woulf live in a big and modern city, not far away from everything like before.
On the other hand she would lose her life in the trailer park.
Together with the other inhebitantsinhabitants they create a good and respectfullrespectful atmosphere.
She would lose her relationships with friends like April May and Corazon.
But she would have a better surrounding!
A roof over her head, a real bed and no town dump next to her.
It would be better for her health and would highlight her life situation.
On the other side, the conditions in foster homes are often really bad too.
Children often have to deal a lot with violence through other foster children.
ExpeciallyEspecially for Pearl, it would be really dangerous.
She is very small and thin, has no power to defend herself.
When you think about the ideas of the American Dream, it would be better if they do everything to give Pearl the chance to improve her situation.
With this she could fullfilefulfil the dream and could help herself.
In a city she has the opportunities to work harder and to grow to the fullest stature of herself.
But this is a risk anyway.
What if Pearl would end up like Helen, when she has to live in foster homes since a very young age?
Children need to be close to their mother, it is really dangerous for her development to take them away.
In addition to that there is, beside the fact of the bad surrounding of the park, no real need to take her away.
Her mother Margot actually cars for her and teaches her a lot.
Why taking a child from her mother when the mother can hendlehandle it?
To sum up, this is a very difficult and diversdiverse question.
In my opinion, in PearlsPearl's case it would not be a good idea to take her away from her mother and her life in the trailer park.
The risk is totoo high that it could destroy Pearl.
Of course, there are many positive aspects, but they are only possibilities.
It can be great for her to live a life in a foster home when she has luck.
But when she has not, it can have a real bad ending, worser than a life in a car.
For Pearl it would be helpfullhelpful if they get financial help from the government.
Maybe with this, they could move on together and can afford a real home.
